did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: John D. Rockefeller, Jr. Library, Colonial Williamsburg Foundation
did.unittitle: Garrett Family Papers, 1822-ca. 1925.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights/ Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Before publishing quotations or excerpts from any materials, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Librarian/ Associate Curator of Rare Books and Manuscripts, and the holder of the copyright, if not the Rockefeller Library at Colonial Williamsburg.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Garrett Family Papers, Manuscript MS 45.1, John D. Rockefeller, Jr. Library, Colonial Williamsburg Foundation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Includes letters; an account of Levin Y. Winder and his guardian; copies of various Williamsburg Hustings Court records; "A Memory of Williamsburg"; an inventory of household furnishings; deeds and bonds; genealogical information; and photographs of Rear Adm. Cary T. Grayson, and of an unidentified young woman.

did.unittitle: Indenture between Robert Anderson, Thomas Sands and Richard Garrett and John K. Wright, Feb 1822.

scopecontent.p: Concerns the sale of Queen's Creek property to Wright.

did.unittitle: List, ca. 1825.

scopecontent.p: E[d]w[ar]d Winder purchases at "Vendue." List of items and prices paid including kitchen furniture, bedsheets, knives, and forks.

did.unittitle: Levin Y. Winder in ac[coun]t with R. R. Garrett, 6 March 1832-14 July 1837.
Bond. Robert B. Moreland and John C. Moreland to Mary M. Garrett, 1 January 1841.

scopecontent.p: Concerns the hiring of a slave.

did.unittitle: Copy of Husting Court records, 13 November 1841.

scopecontent.p: Abner Hockaday vs. William Alvis, and Abner Hockaday vs. Samuel and William Allen.

did.unittitle: Sallie Dix to Dr. Robert Garrett, 24 March 1854.

scopecontent.p: A letter from students of the Williamsburg Female Academy on the death of Annie C. Garrett (Robert's daughter). Includes list of resolutions and a badge of mourning.

did.unittitle: Invitation to the "final celebration" of the Phoenix and Philomathean Societies of the College of William and Mary, 3 July 1877.
Will of Mary Winder Garrett, 27 December 1877.
Will of Mary Winder Garrett, 17 September 1891.
Granville Goodloe, Arkadelphia, Arkansas, to Susan Comfort Garrett, Williamsburg, 2 February 1895.

scopecontent.p: Re: family history.

did.unittitle: Mary W. Garrett, Williamsburg, [to her brother], 7 March 1895.

scopecontent.p: Re: family history. On back of letter is a brief biography of Benjamin F. Garrett (1820-1877).

did.unittitle: Pamphlet: "The Winders of Laston" by F. A. Winder, 1896.

scopecontent.p: Re: 17th/18th-century English ancestors.

did.unittitle: L.J. Waters, at Beechwood, [to a friend], 27 November 1897.

scopecontent.p: Re: Winder portraits and Washington, D.C. art galleries.

did.unittitle: Will of Mary Winder Garrett, 23 March 1899.
Susan C. Garrett, Idaho, to Lottie Garrett, 9-10 June 1901.
Bill from City Livery Sale and Feed Stable to Anna Galt, 1 June 1904.

scopecontent.p: Re: the hire of a horse and buggy driver to Jamestown.

did.unittitle: Sue G. Nelson, Idaho, to Mary W. Garrett, 12 December 1904.

scopecontent.p: Re: family history of Peyton Randolph Nelson.

did.unittitle: Test paper of J. T. Nolen, 11 March 1905.

scopecontent.p: Re: building a phonograph and how sound travels.

did.unittitle: The Women's Club, Richmond Va., to the Misses Garrett, 29 May 1907.

scopecontent.p: Invitation to tea.

did.unittitle: Mary W. Garrett, Williamsburg, to Granville Goodloe, 24 February 1910.

scopecontent.p: Re: family history.

did.unittitle: Address of Robert Southall Bright before the Society of the Descendants of the Signers of the Declaration of Independence...delivered at Independence Hall, Philadelphia, 4 July 1910.
Will of Mary W. Garrett, 7 March 1911.
Susan G. Nelson to [?], post 1915.

scopecontent.p: Letter mentions President Woodrow Wilson's visit to Williamsburg and how Lottie and Mary were invited to the White House. Also family information.

did.unittitle: L. V. Garrett, Newport News, Va., to Mary W. Garrett, "Tazewell Hall," Williamsburg, 19 June 1922.

scopecontent.p: Enclosed is a transcript of an obituary of Richard Roper Garrett who died January 14, 1855.

did.unittitle: Postcard- E[mma] G[arrett] B[oyd], Atlanta, to Mary Winder Garrett, Tazewell Hall, Williamsburg, 21 July 1925.
Emma Garrett Boyd to Miss [Mary?], 24 November 1925.

scopecontent.p: Re: family history.

did.unittitle: Christmas card- Susie and William Maddox to Lottie and Mary Garrett, 1928.
E. Sclater Montague, Hampton, Va., to Mrs. Peyton Nelson ("Aunt Sue"), Williamsburg, 9 April 1930.

scopecontent.p: Re: family matters.

did.unittitle: Letter to Charlotte C. Garrett, n.d.
Garrett family genealogical information, n.d.
"Garrett Family of York County and Williamsburg, Va.," n.d.

scopecontent.p: Family history of Dr. Robert Major Garrett (1808-1885).

did.unittitle: "A Memory of Williamsburg,"

scopecontent.p: Written by one of Robert M. Garrett's children.

did.unittitle: Christmas card of Cary and Gertrude Grayson, n.d.
Handy and Winder family genealogical information,
Household inventory, n.d.

scopecontent.p: Inventory of household items, ca. 20th-century. Perhaps from either Archibald Blair house, Tazewell Hall, or Coke-Garrett house.

did.unittitle: Nelson family genealogical information, n.d.
Randolph family genealogical information, n.d.
Alice Colden Smith to Lottie Garrett, n.d.
Photograph, n.d.

scopecontent.p: Photograph of two unidentified women. Taken by Homeier and Clark, Richmond, Va.

did.unittitle: Photograph, n.d.

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a woman.

did.unittitle: Photograph,

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Rear Admiral Cary T. Graysonan. Taken by Harris and Ewing, Washington, D.C.
